parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the two-piece plastic front fender assembly can cause the rear portion of the fender to dislodge and become wedged between the front forks and the main body of the motorcycle, affecting steering and potentially leading to accidents or fatalities.
symptoms: Cracks or fractures in the rear portion of the plastic fender
particularly at the point where it contacts the metal forks
separation of the rear portion of the fender assembly
difficulty steering or loss of control.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the front lower fender can cause the fender to crack or break off, potentially leading to a lockup of the front wheel or steering, which can result in a loss of control and increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: Cracking or breaking of the plastic portion of the front fender
particularly where it attaches to the front forks
separation of the fender from the mount point
potential lockup of the front wheel or steering.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The engine stalling issue can cause the motorcycle to lose power and stall, potentially leading to accidents, especially in heavy traffic conditions. This can put the rider and other road users at risk.
symptoms: The engine stalls while slowing down
requiring evasive action to avoid collisions; the engine takes multiple attempts to restart; the motorcycle may stall repeatedly.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The faulty EFI system can cause the engine to stall, leading to a loss of power and control, which can result in accidents.
symptoms: The engine stalls due to the EFI system malfunctioning
shutting off the engine to "avoid damage" even when the RPMs are within the safe range; the motorcycle requires an aftermarket EFI unit and adjustable idle control valve to correct the problem.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear brake master cylinder can cause a loss of braking ability, leading to accidents or near-miss situations, potentially resulting in injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: Loss of braking ability while riding
sudden failure of the rear brake system
repeated failure of the rear brake master cylinder.
